title: Virtual Simulation Training for Basic Life Support (BLS) Professional Development

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding basic principles of cardiopulmonary resuscitation (CPR) and experience in handling emergency situations
context.additional_context: Non-degree professional training program combining practice-oriented virtual learning environments with on-site training

learning_goals: Learners can perform immediate emergency actions within 10 seconds upon cardiac arrest in virtual simulation environments.
They apply the CPR standard protocol (30:2 compression-ventilation ratio) with over 80% accuracy.
They demonstrate AED (automated external defibrillator) usage procedures without errors in three consecutive attempts.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
